@graph.name: The BEST Sangria Recipe! | Gimme Some Oven
@graph.description: Hands-down the BEST sangria recipe -- easy to prep in just 10 minutes, and completely customizable with whatever fruit and wine you have on hand!

@graph.name: Ali
@graph.description: Ali Ebright is a freelance recipe developer and food writer/photographer, and the creator of Gimme Some Oven. She also loves all things music, traveling near and far, actually making things from Pinterest, cozying up with a good book and her sweet pup, Henry, and spending time with a wonderful group of friends. Come say hello and follow Ali on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+ & Instagram.

@graph.name: Sangria
@graph.description: Learn how to make authentic Spanish sangria with this easy sangria recipe.  It only takes a few minutes to prep, it's easy to customize with your favorite wine and fruit, and it's great for entertaining a crowd!
recipeIngredient: 2 bottles Spanish red wine (Rioja wine is most popular)
2 oranges, one juiced and one diced
optional sweetener: simple syrup* or maple syrup
optional bubbles: lemon-lime soda, ginger ale or sparkling water

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wine, brandy, orange juice, diced orange, diced apple, diced lemon and cinnamon stick to a large pitcher.  Stir to combine.  Taste and add in a few tablespoons of sweetener, if desired.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours.
Serve the sangria over ice, topping off each glass with a splash of bubbly soda (or sparkling water) if desired.

video.name: Sangria Recipe
video.description: Learn how to make authentic Spanish sangria with this easy sangria recipe.  It only takes a few minutes to prep, it’s easy to customize with your favorite wine and fruit, and it’s great for entertaining a crowd!

review.reviewBody:
This post is a great jumping off point! It made me feel at ease to use what I had on hand. Leftovers Sangria. :)

My fruit mix was lemon, blueberries, and peaches. And the hard alcohol was spiced rum! I didn’t have any fizzy options to use tonight but I plan on trying a dry hard apple cider tomorrow (after I buy some).
Really 😋 delicious. I made the simple syrup from honey, and added fresh ginger to the sangria. It was still really strong for me, so I did serve with half lemon lime soda/half sangria
This is a wonderful recipe! I think the cinnamon really makes it takes extra authentic.
I tweeked it a little for my own taste
We used your idea of making simple syrup with honey and added ruby about if fresh ginger! Ahhhhhhh
